intro: Melothria fluminensis var. macrophylla, commonly known as the Brazilian sourberry, is a climbing vine native to South America. It features heart-shaped, glossy leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to bright orange, tangy fruits. Its fruits are typically 1–2 cm in size and have a high acidity level. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
